conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C and D and we need to predict which container (E or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Liquid flows downward due to gravity and follows the path of least resistance, generally the steepest downhill path.
Point A is at the top left corner.
Point B is near the top center-left.
Point C is near the top center-right.
Point D is at the top right corner.
Liquid from Point A encounters a yellow baffle that directs it slightly to the right.
Liquid from Point A continues downward and encounters another yellow baffle.
Liquid from Point A flows past the orange baffle and continues downward.
Liquid from Point A reaches the bottom and flows into container E.
Liquid from Point B encounters a yellow baffle that directs it slightly to the right.
Liquid from Point B continues downward and encounters another yellow baffle.
Liquid from Point B flows past the orange baffle and continues downward.
Liquid from Point B reaches the bottom and flows into container E.
Liquid from Point C encounters an orange baffle that directs it slightly to the left.
Liquid from Point C continues downward and encounters another orange baffle.
Liquid from Point C flows past the white baffle and continues downward.
Liquid from Point C reaches the bottom and flows into container F.
Liquid from Point D encounters a blue baffle that directs it slightly to the left.
Liquid from Point D continues downward and encounters another blue baffle.
Liquid from Point D flows past the white baffle and continues downward.
Liquid from Point D reaches the bottom and flows into container F.
Liquid from points A and B will flow into container E.
Liquid from points C and D will flow into container F.
